7.3.24  1:01 pm   hello, i have a strong aversion to being told what to do, and i have long known this about myself, but i also just realized i also have a strong aversion to telling others what to do. you seem to have similar aversions, but i was wondering how you got so good at telling yourself what to do? you actually seem pretty good at that. i am struggling. still drowning in the sea of infinite possibility. i think i've even gotten addicted to the feeling of frustration in a way, looking at some of the video games i have played, and beaten. which i guess could be fine if i harnessed that feeling into something more productive and fulfilling. but what if i'm not ready to feel fulfilled? how can i get ready? sorry, i just realized there's a lot to unpack here, and i just asked a lot of big questions....

     how do you get yourself to start something that you know will be big?
7.2.24  11:58 am   should i listen to recordings of improv on jazz standards to figure out what to improv or should i come up with it from scratch. i tried doing it from scratch and only drew blanks

7.1.24  1:39 pm   when it's time to record a part (e.g., guitar solo) sometimes I feel intense anxiety and hesitation. like now is the time to bring an idea I've been sitting on into reality in the form of an audio file and any imperfection I introduce now will taint the project for the rest of eternity. have you experienced this?
